fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

nodes.name: Sticky Note
nodes.description: Allows capturing Notes on the Workflow

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Bg Color

fields.title: Width
fields.description: Width of note

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Complex Customer ETL Workflow:


This workflow performs ETL on a fact and number of dimension files.


It cleans the dataset, computes aggregates for reporting and saves the results.


It then joins the fact data with multiple dimensional datasets to form the big table which is saved.



ETL Workflow:


  • There are fact files and reference data files. 
  • Each fact is described on these dimensions: geo, prod, time, customer.
  • Reference files are CSV and have a header line.
  • Fact file is fixed width and has no header line.



Fact file structure


  • geo_id, prod_id, time_id, cust_id, units_sold, price
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow
